notes: The apprentices and journeymen of London state that they are in favor of the establishment of Presbyterianism and would like to see the disbandment and payment of the army; they also request that the sale of freedoms and intrusions to foreigners into trade be stopped -- Cf. Steele.
Annotation on Thomason copy: "The Apprentices and Journeymans Petition to ye Parlement"; "London. 8 July. 1647".
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
